name: Echo Hunt
description: Send out sonar pings to reveal hidden creatures in a dark ocean, then tap to catch them before they fade back into the black â€” but each ping also wakes up predators that chase your signal.
core_loop: Tap anywhere to emit a sonar ring that expands outward, briefly illuminating sea creatures it passes over as glowing silhouettes. Quickly tap revealed creatures to catch them before the ring fades and they vanish. Each ping also reveals and agitates predators (anglerfish, jellyfish) that swim toward your last ping location, so you must balance pinging to find targets against attracting danger. Catch enough creatures to fill a quota and advance to deeper, darker levels with rarer creatures and nastier predators. Drag to move your submarine's ping origin point around the screen.
retention_hooks: Depth progression â€” each new depth zone introduces exotic bioluminescent creatures and new predator types with unique movement patterns
Catch combos â€” netting multiple creatures from a single ping multiplies score, rewarding precise timing and bold pings near clusters
Bestiary collection â€” every unique species caught is logged with a glowing portrait, driving completionist replays across deeper zones
controls: Tap/click to emit sonar ping at that location, tap revealed creatures to catch them, drag to reposition your submarine (ping origin). One-finger fully playable on mobile.
